messages.subject: Stossel 20/20 tonight & teleconference-failures of public schools
messages.msgSnippet: Forwarding info -- thought many of you might be interested in this very public bashing of public schools... If you are interested in a national teleconference
messages.messageBody:
Forwarding info -- thought many of you might be interested in this very
public bashing of public schools... If you are interested in a national
teleconference about this topic after the show, please read to the end.
*****************************
Subject: Stossel 20/20 ABC special on weaknesses of public
schooling....Alliance hosts two public teleconferences to discuss

"Stupid In America: How We Are Cheating Our Kids"
with John Stossel airs Jan. 13 (10 to 11 p.m. ET) on ABC.
See below how to order a copy or transcript.

In the words of E Ray Moore, good friend and
president of Exodus Mandate:

"Now Stossel and 20/20 are set to puncture the last myth of
complacent suburban
parents who delude themselves by thinking that, whatever problems
there may be
elsewhere, their schools are "different." As Stossel and 20/20 point
out, not
only do our 12th graders do worse in math and science, for example,
than students
in almost all other industrialized countries, the longer our
students are in
public schools, the worse they do in relation to their international
peers."

While I hate to quibble with my friend Rev. Ray, I suspect
it's NOT the last myth. The "public school" establishment
is certainly adept at making up new myths when the
public sniffs the rat in the current myth du jour.

The special is set to run Friday night at 10pm Eastern,
9pm Central, and again at 10pm Mountain, then Pacific,
Alaska, and Hawaii.

The Alliance is hosting two teleconferences on
Friday night.... open to all our Signatories of the
Proclamation.... and the public!

That means you are welcome to forward this to
your own email list .... or even your pesky brother-
in-law who thinks things are just ducky in HIS
local school.

Here's how you connect:

FIRST TELECONFERENCE-----

This will be held 15 minutes after the show
airs in Eastern and Central time zones:

11:15pm Eastern.......10:15pm Central

Mountain and West Coast people are welcome
to come on and get a preview, if you will, from
the reactions of those who have already seen it.

9:15pm Mountain....... 8:15pm Pacific.

Alaska and Hawaii folks.... and even those in
Europe who want to get up in the middle of
the night....are welcome, too. But you gotta
figure out the time for yourself. :-)


SECOND TELECONFERENCE-----

A second teleconference will be held three hours
later: 15 minutes after 20/20 airs on the West Coast:

11:15pm Pacific
which is 12:15am (Sat) Mountain
and 1:15am Central, 2:15am Eastern

We may get some Brits on the second teleconference,
as it will be 7:15am Saturday morning in England..

In fact, I was on the phone for an hour this morning with
James Stanfield at the E G West Centre in England
discussing the show. James Tooley, Director of the centre
(who will receive the Alexis de Tocqueville Award at SepCon2007,
May 4-6, Dallas, was just back from India and his sleep
pattern may have him fit to join us.

HOW YOU DIAL THE TELECONFERENCE-----

Using your cell or regular telephone, from your
own easy chair at home---or driving down the
highway---- dial this number at the appointed hour
in your time zone above:

1 (319) 632-1100 pass code 682-129 #

If you have a noisy background, just press 6
to mute yourself. When you want to say
something, press 6 again to un-mute.

MISCELLANEOUS STUFF-----

John Stossel is apparently quite active in his
blog and frequently responds to emails.

If you want to sound off with praise or a
suggestion about a future education special,
or both, you can do so here:
<http://forums.go.com/abcnews/2020/thread?threadID=284154>
or, if that is busted, try this link:
<http://tinyurl.com/9qz5p>

Earlier, he wrote "If you would like to purchase a tape or dvd, dial
800-505-6139;
for a transcript dial 818-848-6500. Some of my shows can be
purchased from Laissez
Faire Books 800/326-0996 or http://www.laissezfairebooks.com (I'm
told that Laissez
Faire Books expedites the orders faster).
Just as we had finished the Education show, we had to "open it
up" again
because Florida's Supreme Court ruled that public money can't be
spent on private
schools because the state constitution commands the funding only
of "uniform
? high-quality" schools. How absurd. As if government schools are
high quality.
In Florida, and most places, competition, which made even the Postal
Service
improve, is unconstitutional when it comes to public education.

To read the entire E Ray Moore news release about
Stossel's education special, click here:
<http://www.earnedmedia.org/em0111.htm>

======================================

PS: Here is an interesting attack
on Stossel for his attack on public
schools in an earlier "Give Me a Break"
segment.

<http://www.fair.org/activism/stossel-education.html>

It shows the stretching the Public School
Establishment can do to parry all attacks
on it. Here is the beginning of this piece
Note it was done six years ago, about the
time I first met John and we had a nice
chat.
